column4: there are no recommended apps for new users, other than Synaptic or apt/aptitude/etc.  package managers allow you to search through apps that are available, and pick the ones *you* want to use
there is almost never a "best".  the app that suits *you* best is the best for you.  :)
kvirc and X-Chat (easy to use GUI apps), irssi and WeeChat (feature-packed text mode apps) are the ones I recommend you try

for video codecs, follow this guide to start with: https://help.ubuntu.com/community/RestrictedFormats   also install MPlayer, Xine and VLC, or try any of the dozens of Gnome or KDE specific video players (I prefer the first three, they use less CPU)
